review_title: WaterAid is pretty special for the right people...
pros: WaterAid is a diverse and inclusive workplace with the expectation that all staff live by the values set.There is an open door policy to the DT and SMT and this helps employees to build relationships at all levels in a open and transparent way. For me WaterAid as a whole lives and works by its values and mission which makes it a great place to work.  One of the best reasons to work for WaterAid is to know that however hard or challenging a day may have been (and they often will be), you know that you have helped to make someone's life (who is in real need) a little easier whatever role you do, and that is invaluable.
cons: It is a challenging sector to work in....WaterAid is ambitious and with that comes an intensity however compared to other sectors this is balanced out by a commitment to employee health and wellbeing.  You wont become a millionaire working in the sector so if that is your driver its likely not for you. However the other benefits do balance this out somewhat.

pros: A great culture and I truly feel part of WaterAid's mission and like I am having an impact.  It's the first INGO I have worked for and 5 years on I am still here. I don't get bored at WaterAid, I find I can be myself and have the freedom to work in my role.  I have the flexibility to work different hours or from home.  My manager trusts me to get the job done and I am measured on output and not being present in the office. This supports my long commute.
cons: Sometimes we are too committed to the cause and so working hours can get a little long but, to be honest, no one is made to work them we choose to!
